message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper deals with measuring the quality of generated sequences, which is a central problem in many learning frameworks. It proposes a new approach to this problem using contextual embeddings, specifically BERT embeddings, and reinforcement learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the scalability of the proposed approach, which is relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the use of embeddings and reinforcement learning can be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
